Random Numbers From ZINB Distribution

rZINB.Rd

ZINB = zero inflated negative binomial.

rZINB(N, mu.nb, theta.nb, phi.zi)

Arguments

N

the number of random numbers to produce
mu.nb

the mean of the NB distribution
theta.nb

the dispersion parameter of the NB distribution, a single nonnegative numeric value or `NULL` (this refers to no overdispersion, thus a Poisson or ZIP distribution)
phi.zi

the probability of the non-zero valies in the ZI part

Value

A numeric vector of length `N` with random numbers

Examples

table(rZINB(100, 3, 2, 0.5))

#> 
#>  0  1  2  3  4  5  6  7  9 
#> 66  9  5  8  3  2  4  1  2 
table(rZINB(100, 3, NULL, 0.5))

#> 
#>  0  1  2  3  4  5  6  7 
#> 44  9 11 15 10  5  5  1
